intro: Marrubium asumaniae, commonly known as the Asumanian horehound, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, adapting to harsh climatic conditions. It has a compact growth habit with a short stem and is often found in mountainous habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
